meanings.definition: A person who is excessively concerned with saving money and accumulating wealth.
meanings.sent1: The muckworm always counts every penny before spending.
meanings.sent2: The old man was known as a muckworm in the village for his frugal ways.
meanings.sent3: The muckworm refused to buy a new coat even though his old one was falling apart.
meanings.sent4: She hoarded her savings like a muckworm guarding its treasure.
meanings.sent5: The muckworm's obsession with money made him a lonely figure in town.

meanings.definition: To behave in a miserly or stingy manner.
meanings.sent1: Don't muckworm your way out of treating your friends once in a while.
meanings.sent2: He tends to muckworm when it comes to sharing his snacks.
meanings.sent3: She tried to muckworm her way into paying less for the group dinner.
meanings.sent4: The landlord decided to muckworm on the maintenance of the building.
meanings.sent5: If you muckworm on generosity, you may find yourself alone in the end.

meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of dirt or filth.
meanings.sent1: The muckworm boots left a trail of mud across the clean floor.
meanings.sent2: After playing in the garden, the children's clothes were muckworm.
meanings.sent3: The muckworm dog happily rolled in the dirt at the park.
meanings.sent4: The car looked muckworm after driving through the unpaved road.
meanings.sent5: The muckworm hands needed a good scrubbing after working in the garden.
